table_description: Contains daily attendance records for employees, including check-in/out times, work hours, and attendance status from 2025.
use_cases: Calculate work hours by employee or department
data_quality_notes: status is TEXT type with CHECK constraint - use exact matches: 'Present', 'Absent', 'Late', 'Half Day', 'Remote'
check_in_time and check_out_time can be NULL for 'Absent' status
work_hours is DECIMAL(4,2) - may be 0.0 for absences
Sample data only covers recent dates (January 2025) for first 5 employees

table_columns.name: attendance_id
table_columns.description: Primary key. Unique identifier for each attendance record.

table_columns.name: employee_id
table_columns.description: Foreign key to employees table. References the employee for this attendance record.

table_columns.name: attendance_date
table_columns.description: Date of the attendance record. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

table_columns.name: check_in_time
table_columns.description: Time employee checked in. Format: HH:MM:SS. NULL for absent days.

table_columns.name: check_out_time
table_columns.description: Time employee checked out. Format: HH:MM:SS. NULL for absent days.

table_columns.name: status
table_columns.description: Attendance status for the day. Allowed values: 'Present', 'Absent', 'Late', 'Half Day', 'Remote'. Use exact string matches in queries.

table_columns.name: work_hours
table_columns.description: Total hours worked that day. Typically 8.0 for full day, 4.0 for half day, 0.0 for absent.

table_columns.name: notes
table_columns.description: Optional notes about the attendance (e.g., 'Traffic jam', 'Sick leave', 'Work from home'). Can be NULL.
